datasets.name: data.csv
datasets.description: Related to hieroglyphs, Sanskrit, Latin, and deciphering old scripts.

columns.name: sediment_accumulation_rate
columns.description: Average rate of sediment accumulation at the discovery site, in millimeters per year.

columns.name: has_dedicated_funding
columns.description: Indicates whether there is dedicated funding available for the translation efforts of each language family.

columns.name: monthly_translation_requests
columns.description: The number of translation requests received per month.

columns.name: use_of_ml
columns.description: Indicates if machine learning methods were used in the deciphering process.

columns.name: educational_program_availability
columns.description: Indicates if structured educational programs are available for the language.

columns.name: digital_resources_availability
columns.description: Indicates the amount of digital resources available, rated from 1 (least) to 5 (most).

columns.name: vocabulary_size
columns.description: The estimated number of unique words used in the ancient language.

columns.name: archaeology_technology_index
columns.description: A quantitative index of the technological advancement of archaeological tools used in the excavation, on a scale from 1 to 100.

columns.name: preservation_quality
columns.description: Assessment of the script's condition on a scale from 1 (poor) to 10 (excellent)

columns.name: script_characteristic_importance
columns.description: Importance of the script's characteristics on a scale from 1 (low) to 5 (high), e.g., uniqueness or historical significance

columns.name: language_family
columns.description: The family to which the ancient language belongs.

columns.name: script_complexity
columns.description: Complexity rating of the ancient script on a scale from 1 to 10, with 10 being the most complex.

columns.name: current_academic_interest
columns.description: Indicates whether the academic interest in studying the language family is currently high, moderate, or low.

columns.name: available_texts_count
columns.description: Count of deciphered texts available for study.

columns.name: number_of_scripts
columns.description: The number of ancient scripts analyzed for translation.

columns.name: expert_translators_available
columns.description: The number of expert translators available for the project.

columns.name: language_family_rank
columns.description: Ranking of language families based on the commonality of study, where a smaller number indicates a more commonly studied language family.

columns.name: collaborative_effort
columns.description: Indicates whether the deciphering was a collaborative effort between multiple experts or not.

columns.name: academic_conferences_count
columns.description: Number of academic conferences held annually dedicated to the language.

columns.name: geopolitical_tension
columns.description: A measure of current geopolitical tensions in the region from where the script originated, on a scale from 1 to 10.

columns.name: cultural_narratives_discovered_count
columns.description: Number of new cultural narratives discovered as an outcome of the translations.

columns.name: international_experts_involved
columns.description: Whether international experts were involved in the translation process, true for involved, false for not involved.

columns.name: deciphering_method
columns.description: The method used for deciphering scripts: traditional or machine learning.

columns.name: active_researchers_count
columns.description: Number of active researchers (academic and amateurs) dedicated to studying the language.

columns.name: script_complexity_level
columns.description: The complexity level of the script to be translated, rated from 1 (least complex) to 5 (most complex).

columns.name: accuracy_percentage
columns.description: The percentage of accuracy in the translations achieved by the method.

columns.name: has_modern_derivative
columns.description: Indicates if the ancient language has a modern derivative that is still in use.

columns.name: high_accuracy_requirement_percentage
columns.description: The percentage of translation projects that need very high accuracy.

columns.name: script_distinctiveness
columns.description: A measure of how unique the script is compared to others, on a scale from 1 to 10.

columns.name: foundational_for_modern_languages
columns.description: The count of modern languages that are directly descended from or heavily influenced by the ancient language.

columns.name: recent_publications
columns.description: Indicates if there has been a recent publication in the field of ancient languages within the last month.

columns.name: technological_support
columns.description: Indicates if advanced technological support (machine learning tools) is used (1) or not (0).

columns.name: material_complexity
columns.description: The complexity of the material found in the scripts based on linguistic and symbolic features.

columns.name: number_of_modern_speakers
columns.description: Approximate number of people who currently speak the language or its derivatives.

columns.name: international_collaboration
columns.description: Indicates if there is any international collaboration in the translation project.

columns.name: government_endorsement
columns.description: Whether the language receives official recognition and support from the government.

columns.name: media_representation
columns.description: The number of appearances or features in mainstream media outlets over the past year.

columns.name: included_in_academic_curriculum
columns.description: Indicates whether the language is part of the academic curriculum in significant number of higher education institutions (more than 50% globally).

columns.name: translation_time_hours
columns.description: Time taken to translate the scripts measured in hours.

columns.name: is_currently_used
columns.description: Indicates whether the script is still in use today.

columns.name: estimated_origin_year
columns.description: Estimated year when the language first originated.

columns.name: specialized_researchers_count
columns.description: Number of researchers that specialize in each ancient language family.

columns.name: digitized_artifacts_count
columns.description: The number of digitized artifacts available for each language family.

columns.name: recognized_in_cultural_practices
columns.description: Whether elements of the ancient language are recognized and used in current cultural or societal practices.

columns.name: historical_significance_score
columns.description: A score that rates the historical importance of the language, based on findings tied to major historical events or civilizations.

columns.name: deciphering_tools_count
columns.description: Number of tools available specifically for deciphering scripts of each ancient language family.

columns.name: year_of_discovery
columns.description: The year in which the script was discovered.

columns.name: script_age_at_discovery_estimated
columns.description: Estimated age of the ancient script at the time of discovery.

columns.name: review_days
columns.description: The number of days the translations were reviewed for accuracy.

columns.name: artifact_density
columns.description: Count of artifacts found per square kilometer in the immediate area of the script discovery

columns.name: percentage_of_deciphered_texts
columns.description: The percentage of known texts that have been successfully deciphered.

queries.question: What is the relationship between the number of scripts analyzed for translation and the count of specialized researchers for each language family, considering the availability of dedicated funding for translation efforts and the ranking of the language family?
queries.true_hypothesis: The number of scripts analyzed for translation increases with the product of the count of specialized researchers for each language family and a factor determined by whether dedicated funding is available for the translation efforts of each language family, with additional weight given to languages from less commonly studied families based on the rank of the language family.
